title: Integer to Roman
description: Given an integer, convert it to a Roman numeral. The input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.
output_format: A string representing the Roman numeral equivalent of the integer.

examples.explanation: The Roman numeral for 3 is III.
The Roman numeral for 4 is IV.
The Roman numeral for 9 is IX.
The Roman numeral for 58 is LVIII, which is composed of L (50), V (5), and III (3).
The Roman numeral for 1994 is MCMXCIV, which is composed of M (1000), CM (900), XC (90), and IV (4).

hints: Consider breaking down the number into its thousands, hundreds, tens, and ones.
Use a mapping of integers to their corresponding Roman symbols.
Build the Roman numeral string iteratively.
